comments:
When generating a web service client into a java utility project and we also choose to generate the sample jsp, the action will fail if there is already a project named (client project name) + "Sample" and it is not a dynamic web project.

To reproduce this:
==================
1. Create a Java project called "TestClientSample"
2. Generate a web service client on any wsdl file, in the wizard, set the client project name to be "TestClient" and set its type to be "Java Utility Project"
3. Move the slider to the Test position, click Finish.

The following NPE is observed:
==============================

Created an attachment (id=49201)
This fixes the problem if there is a name collision

I have changed the code for creating the name of a new sample project so that if there is a project with a name that we are going to use we check to see if it is a dynamic web project which is required. If it is not a dynamic web project then we need to create the sample project in a project with a new name. I have an iterator that adds a number to the end of the name. I check to see if that name is ok if not try again.
Reopening. Gil, please remember to move your bugs to ASSIGNED state, not RESOLVED state, when you are ready to have your patches reviewed.
Moving to assigned state. Ready for review/commit/release. Thanks for the fix, Gil.

Gil,
the patch is close, however, the following line in the middle of it will result in some nasty resulting strings on three or more iterations (ie. two or more successive name collisions) thru the loop:

sampleP = sampleP + Integer.toString(i);

Would you please rework the patch, and test it with (1) no preexisting non-Web project, (2) one preexisting non-Web project "P", and (3) two preexisting non-Web projects "P" and "P1"?

Thanks - CB.

Created an attachment (id=49550)
fixes the present patch

there was a problem with some of the logic thanks Chris!!
Thanks Gil. Reviewed, approved, committed and released to HEAD and R1_5_Maintenance under tag v200609062128.
